result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Albert Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Albert Lee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Albert Lee was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE's wife called to state that the DE is no longer working & cannot make his pymt.  DE's wife was advised that a WA was already issued for non pymt & he is to turn himself into the jail, pay the bal in full, or write the judge a letter. jaf

DE called to verify receipt of his late May pymt.  Advised DE we have rec'd a pymt, but was $15 short.  DE stated he thought his pymts were to be $20/mo per his agmt.  Clerk checked file & DE clearly requested "$35/mo until pd in full".  I then spoke to a lady who stated she thought the pymts were supposed to be $15/mo & she was advised that it had already been confirmed w/her in April that the pymts are $35/mo ea mo.  She stated she will make the remaining pymt by 4:30pm today. She was then advised that they may come in to the C of C to view the file if they'd like. jaf
From woman on behalf of DE.  Woman stated a pymt has just been made on the DE's behalf. She was advised that it has not been receipted yet. jaf
From DE requesting ext.  Left v/m with DE stating he is approved to make his pymt by 4-20-15 as requested & to return my call if he has further Q's. jaf
From DE verifying receipt of pymt.  Verified Apr pymt rec'd & reminded him of next pymt due on 5-15-15 for $35. jaf

From DE @ 4:15pm stating he cannot get pymt to go thru either pymt service. jaf
From woman on behalf of DE requesting to make pymt over the ph @ 4pm.  Gave woman the pymt options & advised her that the pymt is due at 4:30pm today.  Pymt amt of $35 was verified to her. jaf
From DE requesting ext.  DE approved to make Apr pymt by 4:30pm on 4-20-15. jaf

From DE's fiance on 3-16-15 re: Judge's decision on WA.  Spoke w/DE's fiance, Sodaphy today & advised her the WA will be quashed once the DE provides his current address & phone number as originally requested, but failed to provide on his Pplan request.  Sodaphy did attempt to confirm address, but I advised her it needs to come from him in writing as they do not reside together & he was to provide this info when he was supposed to meet w/Pymt Clerk initially, but left. jaf

From DE's fiance, Sodaphy re: setting up Pplan.  Sodaphy requested to set up Pplan for DE, but was advised the DE must set it up himself.  Advised her that it will need to be verified w/Judge whether DE may send Pplan request letter or if he will need to appear in person. jaf

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Albert Lee
Current: 1393 235th Ave, Barron, WI 54812 United States  (Effective: 12-02-2014)
Prior: 1420 State Hwy 25, Barron, WI 54812 United States

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joshua Hargrove   DF:  Anthony Albert Lee appeared. Case called at 10:26. ADA McKinley makes recommendations.  Atty. Hargrove agrees to recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 removing the repeater and enhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 14CF38 removing the repeater and enhancer. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 14CF38. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- Court costs $443.00
- DE to meet with the pmt. clerk.
NOH/Plea hearing returned by Post Office, attempted, not known, and returned to sender -inmate not in Barron WI.
to continue; filed by Attorney Joshua Hargrove.
Plea hearing on February 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley, NONA by def.  Court called at 3:30 p.m. DE does not appear.  Hallway called.  ADA Mckinley asks for a warrant.  Court authorizes a warrant.  Court adjourned.  lw
Status conference on October 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley,  Anthony Albert Lee pro se. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant and he would like to proceed today without an attorney. Court questions Defendant and finds he is competent to represent himself today and waives counsel.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court enters Defendant's appearance as a special appearance. Defendant waives speedy prelim.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Subject to random testing.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S Mckinley,  Anthony Albert Lee pro se. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant and he currently in the process of hiring his own attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
